articles.title: When Earth Turned to Ice: Scientists Unravel 700-Million-Year-Old Climate Puzzle - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Volcanic carbon emissions reached an all-time low, triggering a global ice age that lasted for 57 million years. Australian geologists employed plate tectonic modeling to identify the most likely causes of an extreme ice-age climate on Earth, occurring over 7…
articles.content: Australian geologists have identified low volcanic CO2 emissions and rock weathering in Canada as key factors behind an extreme ice age 700 million years ago. Their research, informed by plate tecton… [+6153 chars]
